rev.comment: /* Deaths */ The ones we at least can confirm are 6, thanks Lihaas :)

In the first days of the protests at least six recent cases of [[self-immolation]] have been reported in Egypt, including a man arrested while trying to set himself on fire in downtown [[Cairo]].<ref name="Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast">{{cite web|author=David Rosenberg|url=http://www.themedialine.org/news/news_detail.asp?NewsID=31194|title=Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast, Inspiring Protest, Controversy|publisher=The Media Line|date=2011-01-24 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the [[Egyptian Parliament]].<ref name="Abdou">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx |title=In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes |publisher=Ahram Online |date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref><ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim">{{ar}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/7F5D64C8-241F-4F34-B36A-4F259CBF3371.htm?GoogleStatID=20|title=ÙØµØ±Ù ÙØ­Ø±Ù ÙÙØ³Ù Ø£ÙØ§Ù Ø§ÙØ¨Ø±ÙÙØ§Ù|publisher=[[aljazeera]]|date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> Those cases of self-immolation were inspired from, and began exactly one month after the acts of self-immolation in Tunisia where it triggered similar events. So far there have been four{{clarify}}<!--first sentence says 6--> known people who have attempted self-immolation: Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar,<ref name="Abdou"/><ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim"/> Mohammed Farouk Hassan,<ref name="Mohammed Farouk Hassan">{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE70H3L720110118|title=Egyptians set themselves ablaze after Tunisia unrest|author=Dina Zayed|date=18 January 2011 |work=|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> Mohammed Ashour Sorour,<ref>{{ar}}{{cite web|url=http://www.elaosboa.com/show.asp?id=20522&vnum=fesal&page=mahalyat|title=ÙÙØ¸Ù Ø¨Ù'ÙØµØ± ÙÙØ·ÙØ±Ø§Ù' ÙÙØ¯Ø¯ Ø¨Ø­Ø±Ù ÙÙØ³Ù Ø£ÙØ§Ù ÙÙØ§Ø¨Ø© Ø§ÙØµØ­ÙÙÙÙ|author=|date=18 January 2011 |work=|publisher=El-Aosboa Newspaper|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> and Ahmed Hashim al-Sayyed who later died from his injuries.<ref name="Ahmed Hashim El-Sayyid2">{{cite web|url=http://news.yahoo.com/nphotos/slideshow/photo//110118/ids_photos_wl/r3428700330.jpg/|title=Mother of Ahmed Hashim al-Sayyed|author=|date=18 January 2011 |work=|publisher=[[Yahoo News]]|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref>
+
In the first days of the protests at least six recent cases of [[self-immolation]] have been reported in Egypt, including a man arrested while trying to set himself on fire in downtown [[Cairo]].<ref name="Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast">{{cite web|author=David Rosenberg|url=http://www.themedialine.org/news/news_detail.asp?NewsID=31194|title=Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast, Inspiring Protest, Controversy|publisher=The Media Line|date=2011-01-24 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the [[Egyptian Parliament]].<ref name="Abdou">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx |title=In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes |publisher=Ahram Online |date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref><ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim">{{ar}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/7F5D64C8-241F-4F34-B36A-4F259CBF3371.htm?GoogleStatID=20|title=ÙØµØ±Ù ÙØ­Ø±Ù ÙÙØ³Ù Ø£ÙØ§Ù Ø§ÙØ¨Ø±ÙÙØ§Ù|publisher=[[aljazeera]]|date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> Those cases of self-immolation were inspired from, and began exactly one month after the acts of self-immolation in Tunisia where it triggered similar events. So far there have been six known people who have attempted self-immolation: Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar,<ref name="Abdou"/><ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim"/> Mohammed Farouk Hassan,<ref name="Mohammed Farouk Hassan">{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE70H3L720110118|title=Egyptians set themselves ablaze after Tunisia unrest|author=Dina Zayed|date=18 January 2011 |work=|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> Mohammed Ashour Sorour,<ref>{{ar}}{{cite web|url=http://www.elaosboa.com/show.asp?id=20522&vnum=fesal&page=mahalyat|title=ÙÙØ¸Ù Ø¨Ù'ÙØµØ± ÙÙØ·ÙØ±Ø§Ù' ÙÙØ¯Ø¯ Ø¨Ø­Ø±Ù ÙÙØ³Ù Ø£ÙØ§Ù ÙÙØ§Ø¨Ø© Ø§ÙØµØ­ÙÙÙÙ|author=|date=18 January 2011 |work=|publisher=El-Aosboa Newspaper|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> and Ahmed Hashim al-Sayyed who later died from his injuries.<ref name="Ahmed Hashim El-Sayyid2">{{cite web|url=http://news.yahoo.com/nphotos/slideshow/photo//110118/ids_photos_wl/r3428700330.jpg/|title=Mother of Ahmed Hashim al-Sayyed|author=|date=18 January 2011 |work=|publisher=[[Yahoo News]]|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref>
The death toll from the violence had risen to 54 dead and a thousand injured by the 28th.<ref name="asianews1"/> As of 29 January, at least 105 people were known to have died, many or most of them shot, based on body counts at morgues.<ref name=AlJazeera29th1pm/> The city of Suez has seen the most violence of the protests thus far.
The death toll from the violence had risen to 54 dead and a thousand injured by the 28th.<ref name="asianews1"/> As of 29 January, at least 105 people were known to have died, many or most of them shot, based on body counts at morgues.<ref name=AlJazeera29th1pm/> The city of Suez has seen the most violence of the protests thus far.
